intro: Retiniphyllum laxiflorum var. longilobum, commonly known as the long-lobed retiniphyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its foliage is often described as having a distinctive, elongated leaf shape with serrated margins. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
